00017 
00018 /*
00019  * ==============================================================================
00020  *
00021  *                   FCVROOT Interface Package
00022  *
00023  * The FCVROOT interface package allows programs written in FORTRAN to
00024  * use the rootfinding feature of the CVODE solver module.
00025  *
00026  * The user-callable functions constituting the FCVROOT package are the
00027  * following: FCVROOTINIT, FCVROOTINFO, and FCVROOTFREE. The corresponding
00028  * CVODE subroutine called by each interface function is given below.
00029  *
00030  *   -----------------      -----------------------
00031  *  | FCVROOT routine |    | CVODE function called |
00032  *   -----------------      -----------------------
00033  *      FCVROOTINIT     ->     CVodeRootInit
00034  *      FCVROOTINFO     ->     CVodeGetRootInfo
00035  *      FCVROOTFREE     ->     CVodeRootInit
00036  *
00037  * FCVROOTFN is a user-supplied subroutine defining the functions whose
00038  * roots are sought.
00039  *
00040  * ==============================================================================
00041  *
00042  *                     Usage of the FCVROOT Interface Package
00043  *
00044  * 1. In order to use the rootfinding feature of the CVODE package the user must
00045  * define the following subroutine:
00046  *
00047  *   SUBROUTINE FCVROOTFN (T, Y, G, IPAR, RPAR, IER)
00048  *   DIMENSION Y(*), G(*), IPAR(*), RPAR(*)
00049  *
00050  * The arguments are:
00051  *   T = independent variable value t  [input]
00052  *   Y = dependent variable vector y  [input]
00053  *   G = function values g(t,y)  [output]
00054  *   IPAR, RPAR = user (integer and real) data [input/output]
00055  *   IER = return flag (0 for success, a non-zero value if an error occurred.)
00056  *
00057  * 2. After calling FCVMALLOC but prior to calling FCVODE, the user must
00058  * allocate and initialize memory for the FCVROOT module by making the
00059  * following call:
00060  *
00061  *   CALL FCVROOTINIT (NRTFN, IER)
00062  *
00063  * The arguments are:
00064  *   NRTFN = total number of root functions  [input]
00065  *   IER   = return completion flag (0 = success, -1 = CVODE memory NULL and
00066  *           -11  memory allocation error)  [output]
00067  *
00068  * 3. After calling FCVODE, to see whether a root was found, test the FCVODE
00069  * return flag IER.  The value IER = 2 means one or more roots were found.
00070  *
00071  * 4. If a root was found, and if NRTFN > 1, then to determine which root
00072  * functions G(*) were found to have a root, make the following call:
00073  *     CALL FCVROOTINFO (NRTFN, INFO, IER)
00074  * The arguments are:
00075  *   NRTFN = total number of root functions  [input]
00076  *   INFO  = integer array of length NRTFN, with values 0 or 1 [output]
00077  *           For i = 1,...,NRTFN, G(i) was found to have a root if INFO(i) = 1.
00078  *   IER   = completion flag (0 = success,  negative = failure)
00079  *
00080  * 5. The total number of calls made to the root function (FCVROOTFN), NGE,
00081  * can be obtained from IOUT(12).
00082  *
00083  * If the FCVODE/CVODE memory block is reinitialized to solve a different
00084  * problem via a call to FCVREINIT, then the counter variable NGE is cleared
00085  * (reset to zero).
00086  *
00087  * 6. To free the memory resources allocated by a prior call to FCVROOTINIT make
00088  * the following call:
00089  *   CALL FCVROOTFREE
00090  * See the CVODE documentation for additional information.
00091  *
00092  * ==============================================================================
00093  */
00094 
00095 #ifndef _FCVROOT_H
00096 #define _FCVROOT_H
00097 
00098 #ifdef __cplusplus  /* wrapper to enable C++ usage */

00100 #endif

00102 /* header files */
00103

00105 #include <sundials/sundials_types.h>   /* definition of SUNDIALS type realtype */
00106 
00107 /* Definitions of interface function names */
00108 
00109 #if defined(F77_FUNC)
00110 
00111 #define FCV_ROOTINIT F77_FUNC(fcvrootinit, FCVROOTINIT)
00112 #define FCV_ROOTINFO F77_FUNC(fcvrootinfo, FCVROOTINFO)
00113 #define FCV_ROOTFREE F77_FUNC(fcvrootfree, FCVROOTFREE)
00114 #define FCV_ROOTFN   F77_FUNC(fcvrootfn, FCVROOTFN)
00115 
00116 #elif defined(SUNDIALS_UNDERSCORE_NONE) && defined(SUNDIALS_CASE_LOWER)
00117 
00118 #define FCV_ROOTINIT fcvrootinit
00119 #define FCV_ROOTINFO fcvrootinfo
00120 #define FCV_ROOTFREE fcvrootfree
00121 #define FCV_ROOTFN   fcvrootfn
00122 
00123 #elif defined(SUNDIALS_UNDERSCORE_NONE) && defined(SUNDIALS_CASE_UPPER)
00124

00127 #define FCV_ROOTFREE FCVROOTFREE
00128 #define FCV_ROOTFN   FCVROOTFN
00129 
00130 #elif defined(SUNDIALS_UNDERSCORE_ONE) && defined(SUNDIALS_CASE_LOWER)

00141 #define FCV_ROOTFREE FCVROOTFREE_
00142 #define FCV_ROOTFN   FCVROOTFN_
00143 
00144 #elif defined(SUNDIALS_UNDERSCORE_TWO) && defined(SUNDIALS_CASE_LOWER)
00145

00148 #define FCV_ROOTFREE fcvrootfree__
00149 #define FCV_ROOTFN   fcvrootfn__
00150 
00151 #elif defined(SUNDIALS_UNDERSCORE_TWO) && defined(SUNDIALS_CASE_UPPER)
00152 
00153 #define FCV_ROOTINIT FCVROOTINIT__
00154 #define FCV_ROOTINFO FCVROOTINFO__
00155 #define FCV_ROOTFREE FCVROOTFREE__
00156 #define FCV_ROOTFN   FCVROOTFN__
00157 
00158 #endif
